greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let k = n-th nonsquare = A000037(n); then a(n) = smallest prime p such that k is not a square mod p.
comment: In a posting to the Number Theory List, Oct 15 2008, Kurt Foster remarks that a positive integer M is a square iff M is a quadratic residue mod p for every prime p which does not divide M. He then asks how fast the present sequence grows.
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: with(numtheory); f:=proc(n) local M,i,j,k; M:=100000; for i from 2 to M do if legendre(n,ithprime(i)) = -1 then RETURN(ithprime(i)); fi; od; -1; end;
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(k=n+(sqrtint(4*n)+1)\2); forprime(p=2,, if(!issquare(Mod(k,p)), return(p))) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 28 2016
xref: For records see A144295, A144296. See A092419 for another version.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 03 2008
